com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers

Interface Writer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DecorativeWriter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDecorativeWriter, AbstractOutputStreamWriter, AbstractWriter, FileWriter, ListWriter, NullWriter, OutputStreamWriter, PreserveWhitespaceWriter, ResponseWriter, StringWriter, TextWriter, ToggleableWriter, TrimWriter

    public interface Writer
    An output to write to. It can delegate to an underlying writer or keep a buffer in memory. Although the write method accepts any object, implementations may put a restriction on which objects can be written.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Removes all objects that have been written to this writer since the last time it was flushed.
      void close()
      Flushes and closes this writer.
      void flush()
      Flushes everything that has been written to this writer.
      void write(Object object)
      Writes an object.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(Object object)
           throws AluminumException
        Writes an object.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to write
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer is closed or when the object can't be written

      • clear

        void clear()
           throws AluminumException
        Removes all objects that have been written to this writer since the last time it was flushed. Not all writers support this operation.
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer is closed or can't be cleared

      • flush

        void flush()
           throws AluminumException
        Flushes everything that has been written to this writer. If there's nothing to flush, nothing will happen. If this writer wraps another writer, the underlying writer will be flushed as well.
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer is closed or when something goes wrong while flushing

      • close

        void close()
           throws AluminumException
        Flushes and closes this writer. If this writer wraps another writer, that writer will be closed as well.

        After a writer has been closed, it can no longer be used.

        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer can't be closed or has already been closed
